definition: to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success) (idiom)/abbr. for 過五關斬六將|过五关斩六将[guo4 wu3 guan1 zhan3 liu4 jiang4]
(experienced action marker)
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
surname Guan
to behead (as form of capital punishment)/to chop
general/commander-in-chief (military)/king (chess piece)/to command/to lead
to desire/to invite/to request
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])

sentences.english: Uruguay lived up to its reputation and delighted the home fans by disposing of one team after another.
sentences.chinese: 烏拉圭隊不負衆望過關斬將，鄉親們都非常高興。

sentences.english: The team we played against in 1999 was really powerful. It had strength all the way through.
sentences.chinese: 99年與我們交戰的拜仁真的很強，一路過關斬將。

sentences.english: A good performance at a job interview can get you through the gate and past the gatekeeper.
sentences.chinese: 在工作面試中的好的表現可以使你過關斬將。

definition: lit. fight with one's back to the river (idiom); fig. to fight to win or die
lit. to cross five passes and slay six generals (idiom)/fig. to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success)
pinyin: guo4 wu3 guan1 zhan3 liu4 jiang4

definition: to be determined to win (idiom)
to charge and break through enemy lines
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
like a hot knife through butter (idiom)/with irresistible force
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to award a prize
Asian Cup
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
the fabled roc flies ten thousand miles (idiom)/one's future prospects are brilliant

road race

relay race/CL:場|场[chang3]
